docs.title: City Data Model - Transport
docs.text:
This ontology defines service-level concepts for the transport domain using concepts specified in ISO/IEC 5087-1 and ISO/IEC-5087-2. The values for service-level concepts defined by this site are intended to be managed by the transport domain but accessible by multiple city services and stakeholders.

This ontology consists of the following patterns:

  • Micromobility Network Pattern
  • Pedestrian Network Pattern
  • Public Transport System Pattern
  • Rail Network Pattern
  • Road Network Pattern
  • Transport Alert Pattern
  • Transport Network Pattern
  • Travel Corridor Pattern

The ontology also contains the following classes that are not assigned to any pattern:

  • ITS Pattern
  • ITS Thing

The formal definition of these patterns is available in OWL Functional Notation.

docs.title: Alert
docs.text:
An Alert can be used to notify people of important information.

Open interactive Alert diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction activities only activity:Activity beginTime max 1 time:Instant beginTime only time:Instant category exactly 1 code:Code category only code:Code cause only code:Code certainty max 1 code:Code certainty only code:Code creationTime exactly 1 time:Instant creationTime only time:Instant distribution exactly 1 code:Code distribution only code:Code effect only code:Code endTime max 1 time:Instant endTime only time:Instant expiryTime only time:Instant genProp:hasDescription exactly 1 xsd:string genProp:hasDescription only xsd:string headline exactly 1 xsd:string headline only xsd:string issuer exactly 1 xsd:nonNegativeInteger issuer only xsd:nonNegativeInteger lastUpdateTime exactly 1 time:Instant lastUpdateTime only time:Instant location only geo:Geometry rdfs:subClassOf ITSThing recommendation only code:Code referencedAlert only Alert resources only xsd:anyURI severity max 1 code:Code severity only code:Code status exactly 1 code:Code status only code:Code urgency max 1 code:Code urgency only code:Code website only xsd:anyURI

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportAlertPattern

docs.title: Footpath
docs.text:
A Footpath is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of FootpathLinks.

Open interactive Footpath diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 FootpathLink partwhole:hasProperPart only FootpathLink partwhole:properPartOf only FootpathNetwork rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWay

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PedestrianNetworkPattern

docs.title: FootpathLane
docs.text:
A FootpathLane is a type of TravelledWayLane that forms part of a FootpathSegment.

Open interactive FootpathLane diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:properPartOf min 1 FootpathSegment partwhole:properPartOf only FootpathSegment rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWayLane

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PedestrianNetworkPattern

docs.title: FootpathLink
docs.text:
A Footpath Link is a type of TravelledWayLink designed for pedestrians.

Open interactive FootpathLink diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 FootpathSegment partwhole:hasProperPart only FootpathSegment partwhole:properPartOf only (Footpath or FootpathNetwork or FootpathSection) rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWayLink

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PedestrianNetworkPattern

docs.title: FootpathNetwork
docs.text:
A FootpathNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork designed for the use of pedestrians but may be used by others as well.

Open interactive FootpathNetwork diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 FootpathLink partwhole:hasProperPart only (Footpath or FootpathLink or FootpathSection) rdfs:subClassOf TransportNetwork

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PedestrianNetworkPattern

docs.title: FootpathSection
docs.text:
A FootpathSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups FootpathLinks and FootpathSegments for a useful operational purpose.

Open interactive FootpathSection diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart only (FootpathLink or FootpathSegment) partwhole:properPartOf only FootpathNetwork rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWaySection

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PedestrianNetworkPattern

docs.title: FootpathSegment
docs.text:
A FootpathSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that represents a portion of a FootpathLink with common physical characteristics.

Open interactive FootpathSegment diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 FootpathLane partwhole:hasProperPart only FootpathLane partwhole:properPartOf min 1 FootpathLink partwhole:properPartOf only (FootpathLink or FootpathSection) rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWaySegment

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PedestrianNetworkPattern

docs.title: GroupOfLines
docs.text:
A GroupOfLines is a logical grouping of PublicTransportLines for any useful purpose.

Open interactive GroupOfLines diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 PublicTransportLine partwhole:hasProperPart only PublicTransportLine partwhole:properPartOf only PublicTransportSystem rdfs:subClassOf PublicTransportElement

docs.text: Open interactive ITSThing diagram

docs.title: Junction
docs.text:
A Junction is a TransportNode that allows a traveller to connect from one TravelledWayLink to another.

Open interactive Junction diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction rdfs:subClassOf TransportNode

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: MicromobilityLane
docs.text:
A MicromobilityLane is a type of RoadLane that forms part of a MicromobilityPathSegment.

Open interactive MicromobilityLane diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:properPartOf min 1 MicromobilityPathSegment partwhole:properPartOf only MicromobilityPathSegment rdfs:subClassOf RoadLane

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: MicromobilityNetworkPattern

docs.title: MicromobilityLink
docs.text:
A MicromobilityLink is a type of RoadLink designed for micromobility vehicles.

Open interactive MicromobilityLink diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 MicromobilityPathSegment partwhole:hasProperPart only MicromobilityPathSegment partwhole:properPartOf only (MicromobilityNetwork or MicromobilityPath or MicromobilityPathSection) rdfs:subClassOf RoadLink

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: MicromobilityNetworkPattern

docs.title: MicromobilityNetwork
docs.text:
A MicromobilityNetwork is a type of RoadNetwork designed for the use of micromobility vehicles, which have more limited performance characteristics than motor vehicles.

Open interactive MicromobilityNetwork diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 MicromobilityLink partwhole:hasProperPart only (MicromobilityLink or MicromobilityPath or MicromobilityPathSection) rdfs:subClassOf RoadNetwork

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: MicromobilityNetworkPattern

docs.title: Micromobility Network Pattern
docs.text:
The micromobility network pattern specializes the road network pattern to address the needs for the travel of micromobility vehicles.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Micromobility Lane
  • Micromobility Link
  • Micromobility Network
  • Micromobility Path
  • Micromobility Path Section
  • Micromobility Path Segment

docs.title: MicromobilityPath
docs.text:
A MicromobilityPath is a type of Road that is made up of MicromobilityPathLinks.

Open interactive MicromobilityPath diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 MicromobilityLink partwhole:hasProperPart only MicromobilityLink partwhole:properPartOf only MicromobilityNetwork rdfs:subClassOf Road

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: MicromobilityNetworkPattern

docs.title: MicromobilityPathSection
docs.text:
A MicromobilityPathSections is a type of RoadSection that groups MicromobilityLinks and MicromobilityPathSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating areas of shared use).

Open interactive MicromobilityPathSection diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart only (MicromobilityLink or MicromobilityPathSegment) partwhole:properPartOf only MicromobilityNetwork rdfs:subClassOf RoadSection

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: MicromobilityNetworkPattern

docs.title: MicromobilityPathSegment
docs.text:
A MicromobilityPathSegment is a type of RoadSegment that represents a portion of a MicromobilityLink with common physical characteristics.

Open interactive MicromobilityPathSegment diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 MicromobilityLane partwhole:hasProperPart only MicromobilityLane partwhole:properPartOf min 1 MicromobilityLink partwhole:properPartOf only (MicromobilityLink or MicromobilityPathSection) rdfs:subClassOf RoadSegment

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: MicromobilityNetworkPattern

docs.title: NetworkElement
docs.text:
A NetworkElement represents any element of a transport network. It can be a part of another NetworkElement and can be decomposed into smaller NetworkElements.

Open interactive NetworkElement diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction genProp:hasIdentifier exactly 1 xsd:string genProp:hasIdentifier only xsd:string partwhole:hasProperPart only NetworkElement partwhole:properPartOf only NetworkElement rdfs:subClassOf ITSThing rdfs:subClassOf geo:Feature status only ScheduledCode

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text:
• protege:abstract: true
  • xsd:pattern: TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: Pedestrian Network Pattern
docs.text:
The pedestrian network pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for pedestrian travel.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Footpath
  • Footpath Lane
  • Footpath Link
  • Footpath Network
  • Footpath Section
  • Footpath Segment

docs.title: PointOnRoute
docs.text:
A PointOnRoute represents an ordered RoutePoint for a PublicTransportRoute.

Open interactive PointOnRoute diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction index exactly 1 xsd:integer index only xsd:integer point exactly 1 RoutePoint point only RoutePoint rdfs:subClassOf PublicTransportElement routePointType only code:Code

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PublicTransportSystemPattern

docs.title: PublicTransportElement
docs.text: Open interactive PublicTransportElement diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction rdfs:subClassOf ITSThing

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PublicTransportSystemPattern

docs.title: PublicTransportLine
docs.text:
A PublicTransportLine is one or more routes used by public transport vehicles to transport passengers to and from designated locations.

Open interactive PublicTransportLine diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction allowedDirections min 1 code:Code allowedDirections only code:Code partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 PublicTransportRoute partwhole:hasProperPart only PublicTransportRoute partwhole:properPartOf only (GroupOfLines or PublicTransportSystem) rdfs:subClassOf PublicTransportElement

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PublicTransportSystemPattern

docs.title: PublicTransportRoute
docs.text:
A PublicTransportRoute represents one specific path used by a public transport vehicle to transport passengers to and from designated locations.

NOTE: For example, a PublicTransportLine might use an alternate PublicTransportRoute to reach its next stop during periods of congestion.

Open interactive PublicTransportRoute diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction direction min 1 code:Code direction only code:Code partwhole:properPartOf min 1 PublicTransportLine partwhole:properPartOf only PublicTransportLine points min 2 PointOnRoute points only PointOnRoute rdfs:subClassOf PublicTransportElement

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PublicTransportSystemPattern

docs.title: PublicTransportSystem
docs.text:
A PublicTransportSystem provides transport services to members of the public.

Open interactive PublicTransportSystem diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart only (GroupOfLines or PublicTransportLine) rdfs:subClassOf PublicTransportElement

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PublicTransportSystemPattern

docs.title: Public Transport System Pattern
docs.text:
The public transport system pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for public transport travel. Whereas the transport network pattern focuses on infrastructure, the public transport system pattern focuses on the operations that rely on the infrastructure provided by the transport networks.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Group Of Lines
  • Point On Route
  • Public Transport Element
  • Public Transport Line
  • Public Transport Route
  • Public Transport System
  • Route Point

docs.title: RailCorridor
docs.text:
A RailCorridor is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of TrackLinks.

Open interactive RailCorridor diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 TrackLink partwhole:hasProperPart only TrackLink partwhole:properPartOf only RailNetwork rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWay

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RailNetworkPattern

docs.title: RailNetwork
docs.text:
A RailNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork using rails on a stabilized base.

Open interactive RailNetwork diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 TrackLink partwhole:hasProperPart only (RailCorridor or RailSection or TrackLink) rdfs:subClassOf TransportNetwork

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RailNetworkPattern

docs.title: Rail Network Pattern
docs.text:
The rail network pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for travel of rail vehicles (e.g., trains, subways, trams).

It consists of the following classes:

  • Rail Corridor
  • Rail Network
  • Rail Section
  • Track Link
  • Track Segment

docs.title: RailSection
docs.text:
A RailSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups TrackLinks and TrackSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating a traffic control scheme).

Open interactive RailSection diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart only (TrackLink or TrackSegment) partwhole:properPartOf only RailNetwork rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWaySection

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RailNetworkPattern

docs.title: Road
docs.text:
A Road is a type of TravelledWay and transinfras:Road that is made up of RoadLinks. Roads form a proper part of RoadNetworks.

Open interactive Road diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 RoadLink partwhole:hasProperPart only RoadLink partwhole:properPartOf only RoadNetwork rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWay rdfs:subClassOf transinfras:Road

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RoadNetworkPattern

docs.title: RoadLane
docs.text:
A RoadLane is a type of TravelledWayLane that forms part of a RoadSegment.

Open interactive RoadLane diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction next only RoadLane partwhole:properPartOf min 1 RoadSegment partwhole:properPartOf only RoadSegment previous only RoadLane rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWayLane width exactly 1 xsd:nonNegativeInteger width only xsd:nonNegativeInteger

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RoadNetworkPattern

docs.title: RoadLink
docs.text:
A RoadLink is a type of TravelledWayLink and transinfras:RoadLink using a stabilized base designed for the movement of vehicles that conform to a specified set of requirements but may be used by others as well.

Open interactive RoadLink diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction capacity exactly 1 xsd:nonNegativeInteger capacity only xsd:nonNegativeInteger maxLanes exactly 1 xsd:nonNegativeInteger maxLanes only xsd:nonNegativeInteger partwhole:hasProperPart only RoadSegment partwhole:properPartOf only (Road or RoadNetwork or RoadSection) primaryUser only RoadLinkUserType rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWayLink rdfs:subClassOf transinfras:RoadLink travelTime max 1 cityunits:Duration travelTime only cityunits:Duration usedBy only RoadLinkUserType

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RoadNetworkPattern

docs.title: RoadLinkUserType
docs.text:
A RoadLinkUserType represents the unique combination of a RoadLink and a UserType such that speed limits and other characteristics can be defined to apply to specific user types when operating along a particular road link.

Open interactive RoadLinkUserType diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction rdfs:subClassOf ITSThing speedLimit max 1 cityunits:Speed speedLimit only cityunits:Speed travelTime max 1 cityunits:Duration travelTime only cityunits:Duration userCategory exactly 1 code:Code userCategory only code:Code uses only RoadLink

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RoadNetworkPattern

docs.title: RoadNetwork
docs.text:
A RoadNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork using a stabilized base designed for the movement of vehicles, other than rail or air vehicles, that conform to a specified set of requirements but may be used by others as well.

Open interactive RoadNetwork diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 RoadLink partwhole:hasProperPart only (Road or RoadLink or RoadSection) rdfs:subClassOf TransportNetwork

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RoadNetworkPattern

docs.title: Road Network Pattern
docs.text:
The road network pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for vehicular travel. Road networks that are primarily designed for the movement of micromobility vehicles should generally be defined using the micromobility network pattern, which is a specialization of this pattern.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Road
  • Road Lane
  • Road Link
  • Road Link User Type
  • Road Network
  • Road Section
  • Road Segment

docs.title: RoadSection
docs.text:
A RoadSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups RoadLinks and RoadSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating a traffic control scheme).

Open interactive RoadSection diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart only (RoadLink or RoadSegment) partwhole:properPartOf only RoadNetwork rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWaySection

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RoadNetworkPattern

docs.title: RoadSegment
docs.text:
A RoadSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment and transinfas:RoadSegment that represents a portion of a RoadLink with common physical characteristics.

Open interactive RoadSegment diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction numLanes exactly 1 xsd:nonNegativeInteger numLanes only xsd:nonNegativeInteger partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 RoadLane partwhole:hasProperPart only RoadLane partwhole:properPartOf exactly 1 RoadLink partwhole:properPartOf only (RoadLink or RoadSection) pavementType max 1 code:Code pavementType only code:Code rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWaySegment rdfs:subClassOf transinfras:RoadSegment width exactly 1 xsd:nonNegativeInteger width only xsd:nonNegativeInteger

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RoadNetworkPattern

docs.title: RoutePoint
docs.text:
A RoutePoint represents a point of interest along a PublicTransportRoute.

Open interactive RoutePoint diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction isBorderCrossing exactly 1 xsd:boolean isBorderCrossing only xsd:boolean isViaPoint max 1 xsd:boolean isViaPoint only xsd:boolean rdfs:subClassOf PublicTransportElement rdfs:subClassOf TransportNode

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: PublicTransportSystemPattern

docs.title: ScheduledCode
docs.text:
The operational status of an entity, e.g., open or closed.

Open interactive ScheduledCode diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction code only code:Code rdfs:subClassOf ITSThing timeInterval exactly 1 time:DateTimeInterval timeInterval only time:DateTimeInterval

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TrackLink
docs.text:
A TrackLink is a type of TravelledWayLink that uses rails on a stabilized base.

Open interactive TrackLink diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart only TrackSegment partwhole:properPartOf only (RailCorridor or RailNetwork or RailSection) rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWayLink

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RailNetworkPattern

docs.title: TrackSegment
docs.text:
A TrackSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that represents a portion of a TrackLink with common physical characteristics.

Open interactive TrackSegment diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:properPartOf exactly 1 TrackLink partwhole:properPartOf only (RailSection or TrackLink) rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWaySegment

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: RailNetworkPattern

docs.title: TransportAlert
docs.text:
A TransportAlert is a type of alert that can be used to notify people of important transport information.

Open interactive TransportAlert diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction affects only NetworkElement rdfs:subClassOf Alert

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportAlertPattern

docs.title: Transport Alert Pattern
docs.text:
The transport alert pattern addresses the need for public agencies to alert groups to unusual transport-related conditions. Most of the features of the transport alert pattern can also be used for other types of alerts (e.g., meteorological events) and as such, its design includes the definition of a generalized alert.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Alert
  • Transport Alert

docs.title: TransportNetwork
docs.text:
A TransportNetwork is a NetworkElement that is a collection of other network elements that jointly represent a network of paths along which entities (e.g., vehicles, pedestrians) of a specified mode can operate.

Open interactive TransportNetwork diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart only (TransportNetwork or TransportNode or TravelledWay or TravelledWayLink or TravelledWaySection) partwhole:properPartOf only TransportNetwork rdfs:subClassOf NetworkElement

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: Transport Network Pattern
docs.text:
The Transport Network Pattern models the core concepts involved in describing a transport network. This includes an identification of both physical and administrative characteristics. The most general class is that of the NetworkElement, which can be further classified as one of several types of NetworkElements.

A key feature of this pattern is the formalization of the hasProperPart relationship from a NetworkElement to another NetworkElement. This allows for a representation of networks at multiple levels of detail. For example, at one level, a motorway interchange can be modelled as a single Node. But that node is a NetworkElement that can be defined to consist of an entire TransportNetwork that has a node for each junction within the interchange.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Junction
  • Network Element
  • Scheduled Code
  • Transport Network
  • Transport Node
  • Travelled Way
  • Travelled Way Lane
  • Travelled Way Link
  • Travelled Way Section
  • Travelled Way Segment

docs.title: TransportNode
docs.text:
A TransportNode is a NetworkElement that represents a node on the transport network that can be used to designate an end to a link or to join links.

Open interactive TransportNode diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction egress min 1 TravelledWayLink egress only TravelledWayLink ingress min 1 TravelledWayLink ingress only TravelledWayLink partwhole:properPartOf min 1 TransportNetwork partwhole:properPartOf only TransportNetwork rdfs:subClassOf NetworkElement

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelCorridor
docs.text:
A TravelCorridor is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of TravelCorridorLinks.

NOTE: The extent of a TravelCorridor is defined by the extent of the path that shares the designator assigned to the TravelCorridor.

Open interactive TravelCorridor diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 TravelCorridorLink partwhole:hasProperPart only TravelCorridorLink rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWay

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TravelCorridorPattern

docs.title: TravelCorridorLink
docs.text:
A TravelCorridorLink is a type of TravelledWayLink that is made up of TravelCorridorSegments.

Open interactive TravelCorridorLink diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart min 1 TravelCorridorSegment partwhole:hasProperPart only TravelCorridorSegment partwhole:properPartOf only TravelCorridor rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWayLink

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TravelCorridorPattern

docs.title: Travel Corridor Pattern
docs.text:
The travel corridor pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for a more holistic travel view.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Travel Corridor
  • Travel Corridor Link
  • Travel Corridor Segment

docs.title: TravelCorridorSegment
docs.text:
A TravelCorridorSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that logically groups multiple TravelledWaySegments together as being co-located or side-by-side.

Open interactive TravelCorridorSegment diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction corridorElement min 1 TravelledWaySegment corridorElement only TravelledWaySegment partwhole:properPartOf only TravelCorridorLink rdfs:subClassOf TravelledWaySegment

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TravelCorridorPattern

docs.title: TravelledWay
docs.text:
A TravelledWay is a type of NetworkElement and transinfras:TravelledWay that represents the curvilinear length of a transport route that is identified by a specific designator.

Open interactive TravelledWay diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction designator exactly 1 xsd:string designator only xsd:string partwhole:hasProperPart only TravelledWayLink partwhole:properPartOf min 1 TransportNetwork partwhole:properPartOf only TransportNetwork rdfs:subClassOf NetworkElement rdfs:subClassOf transinfras:TravelledWay

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelledWayLane
docs.text:
A TravelledWayLane is a NetworkElement that is a portion of TravelledWaySegment intended to accommodate a single line of moving material entities (e.g., vehicles) along its length.

Open interactive TravelledWayLane diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:properPartOf min 1 TravelledWaySegment partwhole:properPartOf only TravelledWaySegment rdfs:subClassOf NetworkElement

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelledWayLink
docs.text:
A TravelledWayLink is a type of NetworkElement and transinfras:TravelledWayLink. It represents a contiguous length of a TravelledWay between two TransportNodes of operational or managerial significance.

Open interactive TravelledWayLink diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction allowedDirections max 1 code:Code allowedDirections only code:Code from exactly 1 TransportNode from only TransportNode partwhole:hasProperPart only TravelledWaySegment partwhole:properPartOf min 1 TransportNetwork partwhole:properPartOf only (TransportNetwork or TravelledWay or TravelledWaySection) rdfs:subClassOf NetworkElement rdfs:subClassOf transinfras:TravelledWayLink to exactly 1 TransportNode to only TransportNode

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelledWaySection
docs.text:
A TravelledWaySection is a type of NetworkElement that represents an aggregation of TravelledWayLinks and TravelledWaySegments that jointly represent a contiguous length of a path that shares the same management and operational strategies (within the scope of interest of the implementation).

Open interactive TravelledWaySection diagram

docs.title: Formalization
docs.text: Property Value Restriction partwhole:hasProperPart only (TravelledWayLink or TravelledWaySegment) partwhole:properPartOf min 1 TransportNetwork partwhole:properPartOf only TransportNetwork rdfs:subClassOf NetworkElement

docs.title: Other Annotations
docs.text: • xsd:pattern: TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelledWaySegment
docs.text:
A TravelledWaySegment is a type of a transinfras:TravelledWaySegment and NetworkElement that represents a contiguous length of a TravelledWayLink characterized by the same physical characteristics.

Open interactive TravelledWaySegment diagram

docs.title: Formalization
